verses.roman:
tvayeśānugṛhīto 'smi
dhvasta-stambho vṛthodyamaḥ
īśvaraṁ gurum ātmānaṁ
tvām ahaṁ śaraṇaṁ gataḥ

synonyms: tvayā—by You; īśa—O Lord; anugṛhītaḥ—shown mercy; asmi—I am; dhvasta—shattered; stambhaḥ—my false pride; vṛthā—fruitless; udyamaḥ—my attempt; īśvaram—the Supreme Lord; gurum—the spiritual master; ātmānam—the true Self; tvām—to You; aham—I; śaraṇam—for shelter; gataḥ—have come.
translation: O Lord, You have shown mercy to me by shattering my false pride and defeating my attempt [to punish Vṛndāvana]. To You, the Supreme Lord, spiritual master and Supreme Soul, I have now come for shelter.
